text: I'm Amit.

I'm one of the co-founders
and the CEO of Luma AI.

At Luma, we believe that the
future of intelligence is going
to be highly visual, interactive,
and rich, such that interacting

with AI systems will feel
like working with a partner

that is able to show and
explain and interact with you.

Training frontier models,
especially visual models,
is an extremely complicated task.
We train, for example,

on about a thousand times more
data than even the largest LLM
that is out there right now.

This means we need to build
training infrastructure, systems,

data loaders, and everything
from top to bottom
that performs to the max.

The SageMaker HyperPod
product has been one
of the most reliable

and scalable infrastructure
for us. To make it possible
to train the models that Luma builds,
everything in the compute cluster must
work in perfect unison.

That includes the GPUs,
networking, storage, power,

as well as all the software
that drives it together.

In HyperPod, we found
a very reliable system

that brings Amazon's experience
in running global scale

infrastructure and
running it very reliably
and scalably into GPU compute.

Compute and training is a very
significant part of our business

that makes these magical,
really powerful models possible.
We are very excited about HyperPod

and the trajectory that it
is on in delivering reliable,
scalable compute as well as services

that makes training these
models easier and faster
and allows us to go to market quickly.
